flores_passage: In France, people have been voting without technology for a long time: people who are going to vote enter a booth where they go to put in an envelope a piece of paper that has been printed before and shows the person they are voting for. After the officials check that the voter is the one, the voter drops the envelope into the ballot box and signs the voting document. France's electoral law lists the things that must be done at the election. Since the year 1988, the ballot boxes had to be transparent from the inside so that the voters and inspectors can be sure that there are no envelopes at the beginning of the voting and no envelopes are left aside from those that are counted and those of the approved voters. Those who participated in the election can send representatives to witness everything that is being done. In the evening, the votes are counted by volunteers under close supervision, following the prescribed instructions.

flores_passage: The largest coastal mangrove belt in the world is the Sundarbans, more than 80 km (50 mi) from the coast to the tip of Bangladesh and outside India. Sandarbans has been declared a UNESCO protected area. Part of the forest is in India called Sandarbans National Park. The forests are not limited to mangrove swamps - they include some of the remaining intact forests that once filled the Gangetic plain. The Sundarbans cover an area of about 3,850 km2, of which one-third is covered by rain/arid land. Since 1966, the Sundarbans has been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are currently 400 Royal Bengal tigers and 30,000 deer that have been spotted in the area.

flores_passage: Although many of the animals in the parks regularly see people, we must remember that they are only meeting and should not be fed or disturbed.
